learning_outcomes.description: Formulate a data science problem within a given application context by expressing your ideas clearly and by using words and sentence structures efficiently.
Synthesise information from a variety of sources (e.g. academic, business, scientific) and modalities (verbal, visual) to form a communication plan.
Make a convincing argument by structuring your ideas coherently and persuasively, and use visual aids and digital technology effectively to engage the audience.
Apply effective communication skills to explain data science problems to key stakeholders.
Design technically feasible data science solutions with consideration of ethical and legal aspects, and identify appropriate data science technique (techniques) to a practical problem.
Apply project design and scoping techniques to write a detailed project proposal suitable for professionals and stakeholders.

assessments.task_description:
Each student submits a draft of their proposal and the proposal will be marked for the effectiveness of the writing, with a focus on the ability to use techniques covered in this course. Further details will be given in Blackboard.

Use of AI Tools

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT). Students are advised that the use of AI technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The assignment will be submitted in Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Each student submits a project proposal, which contains components such as a problem formulation, exploratory data analysis, proposed solution. Further details will be given in Blackboard.

Use of AI Tools

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT). Students are advised that the use of AI technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Each student will give an online presentation of 8 to 10 minutes on their project proposal, followed by a 5-minute Q&A. Further details will be given in Blackboard.

In accordance with UQ Assessment Policy, your presentation will be recorded.

Use of AI Tools

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT). Students are advised that the use of AI technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The seminar slides will be submitted in Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
Seminar

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05, L06

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 13(24 Feb - 01 Jun)
learning_activities.topic:
Data Science Capstone Project (Part 1)

It is important to remember that you largely drive your project. You are responsible for managing the timely completion of your project, generating ideas, working through difficulties, searching for appropriate resources, and completing your project deliverables on time. Your supervisor's role should be as an advisor and mentor.
